Hi <@U01RU55DN1H>
Not that I'm aware of. You'll have to do something like:
[1] Use Search CRM to look for the Deal in question. If the search returns a result, update the Deal using the returned ID. If no results are returned, create the Deal.
[2] Use the relatively new external record ID feature (search for the heading "Creating your own unique identifiers" in this article: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm>). Here you could first try to create the Deal -- if the Deal already exists in your HubSpot portal (based on your preconfigured external ID property), you'll likely get a useful failure message which you could then use as a condition to update the existing record.
Hope that helps :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@U01UVP5EYE9>
There's a hidden HubSpot default Contact property that might be of help. Its internal name is "hs_calculated_merged_vids". Here's an example of what is stored within this property if the Contact record has been merged:
"hs_calculated_merged_vids": "12345:1609857676448;98765:1609857700448"
Where 12345 and 98765 are example contact IDs. The other returned numbers are timestamps representing when the given contact record was merged.
If this field is blank, I think you could assume the given Contact record has not been merged.
An example GET Contact request URL might look something like:
[1] <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{{CONTACT_ID}}?properties=email,hs_calculated_merged_vids&hapikey={{YOUR_HAPIKEY}}>

or, if you'd like to get contact by email:

[2] <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/example@test.com?idProperty=email&properties=hs_calculated_merged_vids&hapikey={{YOUR_HAPIKEY}}>
Hi Zach, it works indeed. Thanks a lot!

Hi all, im using HubSpot settings api -> User Provisioning. Even though i can create, update or delete a user. But im unable to list all users. Theres a get user by id API available but is there a get all users api?

Afaik you can use workflow automations for that - the trigger needs to be "property is known", then trigger your webhook. And use re-enrollment so it fires again. You should be able to use that to watch stage-changes as well
